thread.title: EU Clears Intel's Acquisition of Altera
thread.title_full: EU Clears Intel's Acquisition of Altera

author: morningstar.com
title: EU Clears Intel's Acquisition of Altera
text:
By Tom Fairless
BRUSSELS-- Intel Corp. (NTC) moved a step closer to completing its biggest ever deal after European Union antitrust regulators unconditionally approved the chipmaker's $16.7 billion acquisition of Altera Corp. (ALTR).
The transaction, announced in June, would help Intel bolster its position in server systems and other equipment found in corporate data centers, the company has said.
The European Commission, the bloc's top antitrust authority, said it had investigated several semiconductor markets where the activities of the companies were "linked," but had found no cause for concern.
Margrethe Vestager, the EU's antitrust chief, said her agency's approval "shows that multibillion euro deals in complex industries can be cleared unconditionally after an initial investigation."
Write to Tom Fairless at tom.fairless@wsj.com
 14, 2015 10:02 ET (14:02
